desc: A 'basic' railway train controller is required for Unity3D. NO 3D assets are required.The controller should allow for a 3D object to be tied to and follow a 'rail' system. The controller should allow for believable though simple physics, for example inertia and weight. Also required of the controller are interactive abilities:- the ability to 'switch' tracks at the users command by way of a button.- the ability to add or remove further 3d models to the train consist (think carriages that can be coupled/ uncoupled).Ideally a weight and power system would be integrated. For example, the 'train' has 100 (units) power and weighs 25. Each carriage weighs 20. Adding carriages to the load will both slow progress and eventually exceed the quota. E.G. 2 carriages makes progress slow, 3 makes it slower still.
title: Railway train controller for Unity3D - Repost - open to bidding

desc: My team is putting together a weekly show on PLAYER UNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS (PUBG) in the spirit of early 2000's Sportscenter.We need a ~30 second intro featuring live-action recordings of us (which can be provided with chroma-key background) spliced into PUBG highlights and a 3d environment.We also need brief (~3 second) stinger graphics to introduce different show segments (i.e. - THIS WEEK'S TOP 10).General style direction of these graphics is "3d graphics just got invented and we have a huge budget to spend on making them look waaaay over the top". "We're not playing it for laughs, but we know it's cheesy". "So cheesy it's good".Some graphical examples of roughly what we're looking for:Example Intro (3d and highlights): [url removed, login to view]Example Intro (live-action of cast): [url removed, login to view]Example Intro Score: [url removed, login to view] (Score can be provided by us).Stingers are same style, but a single dynamic title: "THIS WEEK'S TOP 10", "GUEST INTERVIEW", "TEACHING TIME", etc. - ideally a simple template could be used to tack titles onto, it would be a plus if the template could be shared with us in a format we could edit ourselves on Sony Vegas or comparable software.

desc: Have a requirement for virtual staging.  I am a real estate agent.  I will supply pictures of empty rooms to which I need furniture, pictures, rugs etc. added.  Most pictures will be bedrooms and living rooms.  High resolution, high quality images will be supplied.  Minor Photoshop work may be required before adding staging, just simple blemish/object removal.  We produce high quality work and have done virtual staging before so know all about 3D modelling, lighting etc.Our requirements in summary:Turnaround time of 24 hoursVery high quality, photorealistic workFurniture choice must be modern and contemporary looking in most cases.  The choice of furniture must suit the room.  It’s crucial we build an image that looks desirable.You must supply a final image along with a wireframe model.  I use the wireframe model for marketing purposes to show what the image looks like before final renderingGood communications is a must.  We’ve had experiences in the past where poor communication means we have to go back and revise images.  This wastes everyones time.Your output needs to be high resolution print quality files.  Typically, I want the output resolution to be the same as what we supply.Ensure images are to SCALE.  Do not squeeze furniture and other objects into a space in an unrealistic way.Remember, it is crucial that the image we create is an accurate representation of real life.  Don’t reduce the size of things like beds to fit within a spaceLighting must be realistic.  Some of our partners produce images where they add light sources to places that do not exist in the real photo.  This produces a fake looking imageSomething to the standard of this - [url removed, login to view]Example images are here - [url removed, login to view]The three images we want to trial people on are:1Living room.  Suggest sofa, picture rug etc.2Large bedroom.  Typically a double bed, wall picture/s, rug, small table etc.Remove carpet laying on floor in Photoshop3Smaller bedroom.  Double bed, and as aboveRemove cables in bottom rightThe PDF in the Dropbox folder located above gives some additional information.  It shows examples of renderings we’ve had from another supplier.  Our comments are overlaid on the images and will help you see a real world example of what worked and what didn’t.
title: Virtual staging - Adding 3d furniture to 2d photos

desc: So I am looking for somebody that can create a bot for me that is able to stream music plays. There are some requirements for it though,Userfriendly:I have by no means any coding experience and would like to see an proper GUI to set settings for the bot. Having it work with a firefox browser would be very nice.Multiple instances:The bot must be able to play unlimited individual accounts simultaneous with the option to add more in the futureAutomatic Account creation:The bot must be able to make the accounts themselves and remember it logins for ad supported streaming services. If a user is forgotten (or blocked for that matter) it is removed from the bot system and a new one is created,. It must be able to play all accounts I input that are subscription based.Undectable:At least put every safety measure in to avoid detection.Automatic streaming /w intervals:The ability to adjust metrics like duration, interval, skip through rate (after x songs) to mimic human behaviour. In addition the bot will change every 12 hours their metrics slightly (with 1 to 2%) but between human-like thresholds. I would also like it to have a play counter for each instance as well.Templates:The ability to export and import templates from this bot. Just so settings are quickly up and running. This includes links to playlists.Places to stream:-Youtube- Spotify-Soundcloud- Deezer- Apple Music (I am aware its subcription based, this will be for accounts I own)- Tidal (I am aware its subcription based, this will be for accounts I own)- Google Play (I am aware its subcription based, this will be for accounts I own)- Groove (I am aware its subcription based, this will be for accounts I own)- Amazon Music (I am aware its subcription based, this will be for accounts I own)- Napster (I am aware its subcription based, this will be for accounts I own)Price:We can talk about it, I understand if it would somewhere in the range of $300 to $500. I do have one condition before I pay. I pay 50% up front and want to have a quarter test period to check and verify that it works. I have never done this before and would like to see if my music distributor registers the revenue. If so, you get the other 50% paid.If interested please send me a message.
title: Build music/video streaming bot
